intro: Lasiodiscus usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara mistletoe, is an epiphytic plant native to the montane forests of East Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its hemiparasitic nature, deriving some nutrients from its host plant while photosynthesizing independently. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
